intro: Corispermum glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered bladderwrack, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in parts of Australia and New Zealand. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The species is often found in sandy soils and is considered a halophyte, capable of tolerating high salinity levels.
